pr_title: KOGITO-3009 Consolidate Docker image tests to use kogito-test-utils

timeline.bodyText: I named it KogitoKafkaContainer on purpose to distinguish from the one provided by testcontainers. If both are called the same, final user could have doubts about which one to use.
timeline.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: so I think we should rename Infinispan and Keyckloack to Kogito* ? Its just that the naming is not consistent between these. I dont really have a strong preference for one way or another.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I would rather to append Kogito to Infinispan and Keycloak test containers instead of having a name conflict with KafkaContainer. But that's only my feeling :)
replies.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: np, added Kogito* as prefix for container names.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

timeline.bodyText:
There is an issue here. If the container is disabled by configuration, the start will be called, but the inner container won't be started.
A possible solution to this could be:

Make the start method "final" in ConditionalQuarkusTestResource and ConditionalSpringBootTestResource, so we won't allow to override it.
Add a new method preStart in ConditionalQuarkusTestResource and ConditionalSpringBootTestResource which is executed always when the test resource is enabled.
The new preStart method could return the map and the start method could join the maps.

What do you think?
timeline.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: In that case start map would be empty so the entire logic here would be skipped. Am I missing something?
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Well, we're relying on an underlying implementation detail: start() returns an empty map. Tomorrow, it might return an inmmutable map and this code would return an exception. Or maybe we could decide to inject the parameters in the start() method.
replies.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: ok, for now I changed the implementation so that it doesnt matter if the returned map is immutable or not. Regarding future improvements, we can look into that as needed :)
replies.author: cristianonicolai
